abstracts.cdata!:
Using funding from the global
            environment fund (GEF) and World Bank expertise on nutrient
            reduction and European Union (EU) environmental regulations,
            Serbia has begun reducing nutrient pollution from
            agricultural practices in the Danube and its tributaries.
            Farms that implemented cost-effective ways of reducing
            nutrient runoff by properly managing animal waste and
            recycling it as fertilizer between 2008 and 2011 reduced
            annual nitrogen discharge by 44 percent and phosphorus by
            100 percent, while also lowering the cost of farming.
